description: Lenart Kova, witnessing growing unrest and ongoing BCI confusion, decides to quietly release a tool that enables neighborhood groups to rewrite BCI scoring rules. He uploads the coded admin toolkit and instructions to trusted citizen contacts, urging caution and consensus.

A coded admin access file for BCI rule editing quietly appears on trusted citizen forums, accompanied by simple instructions in plain language. News of its presence spreads quickly among active neighborhood groups.

Neighborhood assemblies gather in public squares and openly debate, then begin rewriting local BCI rules using the new toolkit. Citizen-crafted proposals are projected for all to see, signaling a dramatic shift away from Council authority.
Districts trial their own BCI scoring systems after neighborhood votes. Conflicts arise at the borders over fairness and eligibility for services, fracturing previous citywide routines.

Amid rapid divergence, Council factions hold emergency talks. Harmonists push for a return to order; Innovators seek ways to harness citizen input, and the Directorate threatens to intervene if instability worsens.
